Key Match Events: Precious Achiuwa led the Knicks to a 111-105 victory over the Charlotte Hornets, finishing with 20 points and 16 rebounds.
Deuce McBride continued to impress with 18 points and 5 assists, while new addition Cam Payne had 16 points and 8 assists of his own.
Pre-Game Insights: The Knicks looked forward to a Friday night matchup in Washington to close out the preseason, hoping to go undefeated and head into the regular season on a high note.
The 2024-2025 NBA season is the most highly anticipated campaign the Knicks have begun in over two decades.
Post-Match Reflections: The Knicks' victory over the Hornets improved their preseason record to 4-0, with one exhibition matchup remaining against the Wizards before the NBA season officially begins next Tuesday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Knicks showed tribute videos to Julius Randle and Donte DiVincenzo on the big board at the Garden as they returned to New York as opponents for the first time since the deal was made.
Donte DiVincenzo was seen yelling towards the Knicks bench early on, although it wasnâ€™t entirely clear who he was speaking to or what was said.
Others: The Knicks' new-look team has been impressive in the preseason, with Karl Anthony-Towns showing out in his first performance in front of his new home crowd at the Garden, finishing with 25 points, 12 rebounds, and 2 assists.

The Knicks have one exhibition matchup remaining, on Friday against the Wizards, before the NBA season officially begins next Tuesday with a primetime contest against the defending champions in the Boston Celtics.
